title: BBC Local Live: Nottinghamshire on Thursday 19 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: man campaigns for authorities to get tough on cycling on pavements .
greengrocer says only 50 boxes of courgettes are coming to nottingham .
mansfield town 's chris clements could be off to grimbsy town .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for nottinghamshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: weather : staying cloudy for tonight
text: another cloudy and misty evening with some drizzle possible .
lows of 6c ( 42f ) .

documents.title: mansfield 's clements heads to grimsby
text: grimsby town have completed their signing of mansfield town midfielder chris clements on an 18-month deal
it was for an undisclosed fee .
he 's expected to play in the side against notts on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: al hasawi pledges 'complete and utter commitment ' to club
text: nottingham forest owner fawaz al hasawi has affirmed his commitment to the club with the appointment of samantha gordon as chief financial officer .
he said : `` i feel it 's my responsibility to directly assure you of my complete and utter commitment to nottingham forest . ''
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: barrister said daughter left notes
text: mr mansfield qc said notes left by his daughter anna suggested that she felt like a failure .
he said : `` she left notes saying she thought she failed her children nobody agrees with that , but that 's where she placed herself . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: couple hope to make a difference with group
text: now with his partner , yvette greenway , mr mansfield has set up the campaign group sos ( silence of suicide ) .
in nottingham it is working with the wright initiative to offer monthly support and a big event is planned for the albert hall in march which the couple will attend .
they said they hoped the group would help people thinking of suicide talk through their problems , and also help people bereaved through suicide .
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: lawyer launches suicide support group
text: leading human rights lawyer michael mansfield qc has been in nottingham to launch a monthly support group for people affected by suicide .
the 75-year-old has been involved with high profile court cases including the guildford four , the birmingham six and represented the families at the hillsborough tragedy inquests .
his daughter , anna , took her own life in 2015 , three weeks after getting notice of redundancy from work .
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: tennis : evans prepares for third round match
text: dan evans is preparing for his third round match against bernard tomic in the australian open .
he trains in nottingham so we 're going to claim him as our own .
he 'll be in action in the early hours of tomorrow morning after murray 's match against american sam querrey .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: is this the perfect job ?
text: professional lego builder , warren elsmore , gave up his job as an it consultant to play with lego for a living and the exhibition is a collection of what he has put together .
he said : `` i 've been playing with lego bricks since i was three . ''
`` there really is n't anything you ca n't do in lego . ''
and he 's right !
he 's managed to create everything in lego from the grand canyon and an african savannah to castles and london city airport .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: lego exhibition comes to nottinghamshire
text: if you love lego then a new exhibition coming to nottinghamshire will be right up your street .
brick wonders opens at the weekend at the harley gallery in welbeck with 70 models of landmarks and features from around the world .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: m1 reopens after crash
text: the # m1 southbound between junctions 29 and 28 has now reopened following an earlier collision between a car and a van .
updates to follow .

documents.title: cyclist fined after pavement accident
text: a reader has been in touch to say he was hit by a cyclist on a pavement in lace street , dunkirk .
he said one day he was `` immediately confronted by a cyclist '' who slammed on his brakes and was thrown forward with the impact .
the man said the cyclist 's helmet hit him in the face and damaged his glasses causing cuts to his face .
he added : `` i went to [ the ] local police station and presented all the information to an officer .
he said he would check that the pavement was not designated for cycles and pursue the cyclist who had collided with me .
he kept me informed of progress and finally told me that the person had been interviewed and accepted a £ 30 fine .
i was happy with the result . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: notts still working on transfer embargo
text: notts manager kevin nolan has confirmed the embargo is n't lifted yet .
he said the club is working hard to do so but thinks the team will stay in league two even if it is n't lifted .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: swan rescued by rspca
text: for anyone worried about the swan wandering around in david grove , bramcote , this morning , it was safely taken away by the rspca soon after the photo was taken .
nottinghamshire police said they received a call from a concerned member of the public after they had struggled to get hold of local animal rescue agencies .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : nottingham panthers back home after win
text: the british contingent of nottingham panthers were in the east midlands today studio last night to talk about their history-making win at the weekend .
see what they had to say
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: bomb teams sent to 12 schools
text: remember when we told you about bomb disposal squads being called out to schools in nottinghamshire to carry out controlled explosions .
it was in the wake of government advice about how a potentially hazardous chemical should be stored in school labs .
it 's now been revealed that there were 12 call-outs at schools in our region between october and december last year .
in leicestershire , teams were called out to seven schools and there were five in derbyshire .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: forest 's lansbury on verge of villa move
text: aston villa are set to complete the signing of nottingham forest captain henri lansbury tomorrow .
the reds had rejected an offer for the midfielder from rivals derby county earlier this month .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: police concern for missing girl
text: we told you earlier about missing 15-year-old kirsten marechal .
now police say another teenager , 18-year-old charnel woodward , is also missing .
they were both reported missing from the sherwood rise area at about 00:30 this morning .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: one person seriously hurt in crash
text: one person suffered serious injuries in the crash on the m1 southbound .
it involved a van and car and happened just before 10:00 .
it has caused long delays for drivers this afternoon .
the road is expected to reopen in the next hour .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: mansfield sign peterborough 's coulthirst
text: mansfield town have signed peterborough united forward shaquile coulthirst on loan until the end of the season .
the stags have an option of signing a permanent deal with the 22-year-old striker .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: police release from m1 crash
text: # m1 j29 to j28 will remain closed for collision investigation work , recovery of vehicles & cleaning road surface .
estimated opening at 3pm .
yes they have .

yes .

shelley

author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: boy threatens staff in netherfield bank robbery
text: police are investigating a robbery at the natwest bank in victoria road , netherfield , yesterday afternoon , thought to have been carried out by a teenager .
staff were threatened by a boy , aged 15 or 16 , before he ran off with cash at about 14:00 .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: council putting together 'business plan '
text: the decisions follow a public consultation into leisure centre provision in the district .
the council has previously said it thinks it might be better to focus resources on larger facilities in the area .

the future of edgwood leisure centre in hucknall was in doubt , but the authority says its consultation shows the venue has backing from locals , who want to see swimming facilities retained in the area if possible .
it 's inviting community groups or other interested parties to submit a `` sustainable business plan '' for huthwaite .
author: Christian Hewgill
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: two people in hospital after crash
text: two people have been taken to hospital after a crash involving several vehicles on the m1 .
the southbound stretch is still closed between j29 ( chesterfield ) and j28 ( mansfield )
author: Kevin Stanley
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: changes to leisure centres plan
text: ashfield district council is expected to confirm plans to close or seek an alternative provider to run huthwaite leisure centre this evening .
but it appears to have shelved plans to close its edgwood centre .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: swanning about in bramcote
text: this swan has been causing a fuss in david grove , bramcote this morning .
police were called to move the bird along
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: delays on m1 near mansfield
text: the emergency services are at the scene of the crash on the m1 southbound .
the motorway is closed between j29 ( chesterfield ) and j28 ( mansfield ) which is causing some tailbacks for motorists .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : m1 southbound closed near mansfield
text: the m1 southbound is closed between j29 ( chesterfield ) and j28 ( mansfield ) because of a multi-vehicle accident .
diversions have been put in place .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: work starts on nottingham eyesore
text: the pub was destroyed by a fire in 2006 and has stood derelict ever since .
after being fenced off for 10 years , work starts today on landscaping the old pub site at the arboretum , all thanks to @ twitterid funding !

documents.title: police say they have other priorities
text: we 've had statements from nottinghamshire police and nottingham city council on the cycling on pavements issue .
police said while it is an offence there is a low risk of injury to pedestrians and fining cyclists `` does not justify concentrated police efforts and resource '' .
while the council said they were working to create more routes to separate cyclists and pedestrians .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: concerns for missing 15-year-old
text: have you seen 15-year-old kirsten marichal ?
she was last seen in hyson street , radford at 00:15 this morning .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: is courgetti to blame ?
text: i blame the new healthy trend of eating courgetti , or spiralised courgette , for the shortage .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: price hike in courgettes
text: mr thompson , who runs a greengrocer in hayden road , sherwood , said only 50 boxes of courgettes were arriving in nottingham most weeks for the whole city .
and as a result , just one of their courgettes will now set you back £ 1.90 !
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: people want vegetables out of season
text: radio nottingham 's hayley compton went to meet greengrocer steven thompson , who said people in the uk were `` obsessed '' with the vegetable and eating them out of season .
`` prices have doubled but people still buy them , '' he said .
courgettes are grown in the uk in the summer but mr thompson said in winter they are imported from warmer countries - which have struggled this year .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: courgettes in short supply
text: it 's a familiar vegetable in our supermarkets but there is a shortage on the shelves this winter , and everyone 's in a panic .
whether you like it grilled , spiralised or in your lasagne , the courgette is in short supply at the moment .
it 's all because of bad weather in spain and italy , which has affected growing conditions .
so there are less courgettes coming to the uk , and this has led to higher prices too .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: could clements be off soon ?
text: we understand mansfield town midfielder chris clements is close to joining grimsby town .
the deal could be done today .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: cycling fines have halved
text: if you 're not sure of the law on this , it is illegal to ride your bicycle on a pavement , as set out by the highway code .
but since 2013 the number of fines handed out to cyclists who ignore this has more than halved .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: man fears accident on pavements
text: i met michael dybala at bobbers mill bridge this morning .
fed up of dodging cyclists , he wants police and the city council to get tough on people who ride on the pavements .
he said : `` the worst is when the cyclist rides up behind you and you ca n't see them so if you step to one side for a minute there 's a risk of a collision . ''
author: Hayley Compton
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: man 's crusade to ban cycling on pavements
text: a nottingham man has started a campaign urging the police and council to get tough on cyclists who ride on pavements .
he says the issue is being ignored and wants the authorities to take it more seriously .
radio nottingham has been out to see him this morning .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : congestion on the roads this morning
text: there is a lot of slow traffic about today .
there are too many problem spots for me to list all of them , but check your journey here before you head out .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : another cloudy day ahead
text: weather : another cloudy day ahead
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: join us for today 's updates
text: i 'm in the hot seat today writing your news , weather and sport for nottinghamshire .
today we 're talking lego and a shortage in courgettes .
author: Sandish Shoker
